title: Google Play Store rolls out a11y tags to make it easier to find accessibility apps
content:
On Global Accessibility Awareness Day, Google announced several new accessibility features, including alt-text support in Gmail and native support for braille displays in Android. In its push to make Android more accessible, Google is also making it easier to search for accessibility apps in the Google Play Store. Google has started tagging accessible apps in

The post Google Play Store rolls out a11y tags to make it easier to find accessibility apps appeared first on XDA.
description: Google has started tagging accessible apps in the Play Store with relevant accessibility (a11y) tags. Read on.
